title: Mastering Logical Conditional Proofs Using Set-Based Reasoning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Propositional Logic and Basic Set Operations (Union, Intersection, Complement)
context.additional_context: Workplace decision-making logic enhancement program for managerial adult learners. Primary focus on analyzing logical fallacies within language domains and improving clear communication skills

learning_goals: Learners can visually represent the logical structure of conditional statements (p → q) using set diagrams
Learners can comparatively explain various proof methods (direct proof, contrapositive proof, proof by contradiction) through set-based reasoning
Learners can identify logical fallacies (false dilemma, circular reasoning, etc.) by analyzing work cases and reconstruct them using set models

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
